interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Grey Zone
Review Date: 2010/10/26
Store: David Arquette  (Actor),     Velizar Binev  (Actor),     Tim Blake Nelson  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
Product Description: ['Product description', "Based on the real-life events and featuring a first-rate ensemble cast, this compelling and harrowing film chronicles a unit of Auschwitz's Sonderkommando, a special squad of Jewish prisoners, who staged the only armed revolt that would ever take place at Auschwitz.", 'Amazon.com', 'The title of Tim Blake Nelson\'s harrowing drama of Jewish death camp prisoners who rise up against their captors to "destroy the machinery" refers as much to the compromise and cloudy morality of collaboration as to the gray world coated in the smoke and ash of the crematoriums. Inspired by real-life events at the Auschwitz death camp,', 'The Grey Zone', "stars David Arquette as a soul-deadened laborer whose being fiercely jolts to life when he finds a young girl alive among the gassed corpses. He's the heart and soul of an outstanding cast that includes Steve Buscemi and Daniel Benzali as revolt leaders, Allan Corduner as the shunned camp doctor, and Harvey Keitel as the commandant. Nelson's rapid pacing, intimate shooting, and terse, jagged dialogue give the moral debate a discomforting immediacy as it races a deadline. When doom hangs in the air, sure death creates unique priorities.", '--Sean Axmaker']
Average Rating: 4.1
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'David Arquette, Dimitar Ivanov, David Chandler, Daniel Benzali, Steve Buscemi, Miklos Nyiszli, Velizar Binev, Tim Blake Nelson, Harvey Keitel, Kamelia Grigorova, Allan Corduner, George Zlatarev, Henry Stram, Michael StuhlbargDavid Arquette, Dimitar Ivanov, David Chandler, Daniel Benzali, Steve Buscemi, Miklos Nyiszli, Velizar Binev, Tim Blake Nelson, Harvey Keitel, Kamelia Grigorova, Allan Corduner, George Zlatarev, Henry Stram, Michael Stuhlbarg  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.25 x 0.75 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2223629', 'Director': 'Tim Blake Nelson', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 17, 2003', 'Actors': 'David Arquette, Velizar Binev, David Chandler, Michael Stuhlbarg, George Zlatarev', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lions Gate', 'Writers': 'Miklos Nyiszli, Tim Blake Nelson', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I found the movie interesting but it won't be a movie a will watch over and over. it told the story of the crematorium worker who planned a rebellion. also it told the story of the girls who worked in the amunition factory and smuggled the explosives. the story about the little girl they found alive after a gassing was a bit strange. especially on the end where the SS shoots her. all in all they subject was well, but i just didn't enjoy the movie as much as i should have.
Review Title: Interesting
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Woman in Berlin
Nina Hoss  (Actor),     Evgeny Sidikhin  (Actor),     Max Faerberboeck  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Directed by Max Ferberbrock (Aimee & Jaguar) and based on an international bestselling diary. Berlin, 1945, women become the victims of the Red Army invasion. One of them, Anonyma, decides to look for an officer who can protect her. A complex symbiotic relationship develops between her and a Russian officer that will force them to remain enemies until the bitter end. In German and Russian with English subtitles.']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.54 x 5.37 x 7.57 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'STDV2904DVD', 'Director': 'Max Faerberboeck', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 10, 2009', 'Actors': 'Nina Hoss, Evgeny Sidikhin, Irm Hermann, Rudiger Vogler, Ulrike Krumbiegel', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Strand Home Video', 'Number of discs': '1'}
this was a great movie. i had read the book already twice, both in german and english. the movie is more enjoyable if you can at least understand german. but the english subtitles were sufficiant. the story is a true account of what happend to the city of Berlin at the end of WWII. my grandmother and her sisters and my mother and her mom expierienced the end of the war in Berlin and their story were similar. the book though also touches on the end how Berlin was rebuild out of ashes and roubles. there is even a man made mountain of rubble in Berlin which has a statue of a woman to honor the women of Berlin who helped rebuild the city. too bad that the movie does not portrait that part of the book.
great movie
Hallmark The Courageous Heart of Irena Sendler Hall of Fame War
Rated:    PG    Format: Unknown Binding
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['The Courageous Heart of Irena Sendler Hallmar']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Media Format': "DVD, Collector's Edition", 'Studio': 'Hallmark'}
the Irena Sendler movie was definately worth purchasing. i am a great fan of Goran Visnjic and enjoyed his role in the movie. i had never heard of this ladies story and i was surprised that students in Kansas discovered her story. unbelievable the way Miss Sendler risked her life to rescue many Jewish children in the Warsaw Ghetto. it was wonderful to see that there were people courageous enough to risk their lives for the Jewish population. and i did love the happy ending even though Miss Sendler was sick from her imprisonment.
This Hallmark movie was great

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user demonstrates a strong affinity for historical dramas, particularly those set during significant wartime events, with an emphasis on authentic narratives and cultural histories. Their recent engagement with a film examining the complexities of rebellion within death camps reflects a continued interest in stories that highlight humanity's courage and moral dilemmas during crises.
  
- **Language Proficiency:** The user's bilingual skills indicate a preference for original language content, especially German, while accommodating English subtitles, showcasing a passion for foreign films.

- **Cultural Connection:** A deep personal connection to Berlin's history underlines the user's interest in narratives that resonate with personal or ancestral experiences related to WWII and post-war reconstruction.

- **Literary Background:** The user enjoys reading and has a penchant for adapted literature, frequently exploring historical figures and lesser-known stories across different mediums.

- **Rating Behavior:** They typically provide high ratings for content resonating with personal interests, though recent reviews indicate that while they appreciate the subject matter, emotional engagement varies, reflecting a discerning taste.

- **Emotional Engagement:** The user values complex human relationships under extreme circumstances, as demonstrated in their latest interaction, where they found the historical narrative compelling yet noted limitations in enjoyment, signaling their selective emotional engagement with the material.

Overall, the user maintains a thoughtful approach to media, focusing on depth, authenticity, and emotional resonance in their viewing choices, particularly in real-life historical accounts.
